ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: - learned how to better critically read papers - learned a lot about the biochemical backgrounds of the clinical diseases we learned in class
How to think like a scientist.
Enjoyed reading papers that connected with med school, enjoyed the interactiveness, wish it be continued the entire year

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: strengths: - I loved having Dr. Baserga as my discussion group leader. She added a lot of insight to the discussions and asked the important questions - I really enjoyed all of the topics that we had weaknesses: - sometimes we got really off tangent - there were times when smaller discussions distracted from the greater discussion that was happening

I actually enjoyed some of the days where every student was required to speak because it felt a lot more engaging. I think more students were encouraged to participate the class would be even greater.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, the course helped me develop a framework for diving into research related to a variety of medical topics in sync with class topics.
